subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: ... Oops, let me try again: LOT = PALM, TRAP = BATH, THOUGHT = CLOTH, NORTH = FORCE, NURSE = LETTER, FLEECE = HAPPY, COMMA = STRUT.  Remember that LETTER,
messageBody:
John Cowan scripsit:

> I'll just mention that my English merges these sets: LOT = PALM, TRAP =
> BATH, THOUGHT = CLOTH, NORTH = FORCE, NURSE = UTTER.

Oops, let me try again:

LOT = PALM, TRAP = BATH, THOUGHT = CLOTH, NORTH = FORCE, NURSE = LETTER,
FLEECE = HAPPY, COMMA = STRUT. Remember that LETTER, HAPPY, COMMA are
about the unstressed vowels, not the stressed ones.

--
What is the sound of Perl? Is it not the John Cowan
sound of a [Ww]all that people have stopped cowan@...
banging their head against? --Larry http://www.ccil.org/~cowan

John Cowan scripsit:

> I'll just mention that my English merges these sets: LOT = PALM, TRAP =
> BATH, THOUGHT = CLOTH, NORTH = FORCE, NURSE = UTTER.  

Oops, let me try again:

LOT = PALM, TRAP = BATH, THOUGHT = CLOTH, NORTH = FORCE, NURSE = LETTER,
FLEECE = HAPPY, COMMA = STRUT.  Remember that LETTER, HAPPY, COMMA are
about the unstressed vowels, not the stressed ones.
